title: How to determine potential MAC spoofing?
content: Per the settings on my Pixel 3, the MAC address should be 3c:28:6d:f1:c2:98. However, when I connect to my home WiFi network, the MAC that appears is listed as de:85:65:28:c5:8e. When I look up the MAC address de:85:65:28:c5:8e this vendor does not exist and is completely different from Google's vendor MAC of 3c:28:6d. Could someone explain why this is, and inform me if there is a possibility that my phone has been compromised in any form?
